intro: Carex xueyingiana, commonly known as the Xueying sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern China. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants commonly found in moist environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads that are typically green or brown in color. It thrives in wet or semi-aquatic habitats, such as marshes and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
